recipe.name: Pizza Dough
recipe.ingredients:
Makes enough for 1 12'' pizza, medium thickness, or 1 10'' very thin pizzas
2 1/2 teaspoons instant yeast 1 tablespoon sugar 284 grams (1 1/4 cups) water 382 grams (13 1/2 ounces) bread flour (about 3 cups) 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus additional for drizzling 1 teaspoon salt 28 grams (1 ounce) grated parmesan cheese)

step.describe:
Add all ingredients.
Repeat the blending 4 times by pressing "cook again", total, until dough is cohesive.
Add about 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a plastic bag, then transfer the dough to the bag. Seal the bag and refrigerate for a few hours or up to 3 days.
When you're ready to use the dough, heat the oven to 450 degrees with a pizza stone in the oven.
Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Flour your work surface and turn out the dough. Form the dough into a ball (or divide in half and form into 2 balls, if you wish to make 2 smaller pizzas)
Roll the dough into a flat disk that will fit your pizza paddle (to transfer the pizza) and your pizza stone. Add sauce and toppings as desired.
Transfer the pizza to the stone in the oven (alternatively, you can bake the pizza on a pizza pan, or form it on parchment paper and transfer the pizza to the oven on the parchment).

Bake at 450 degrees until the crust is browned on the bottom and edges and the cheese is melted and bubbling and the toppings are hot. A small, thin pizza will take 8-10 minutes; a larger pizza will take 15 minutes or more.
